Description: Weight: fals weight of 30 kharrūba. Ten line Kufic inscription. Made of green glass.
Curator's comments: See also OA+ 4173, OA+ 4174 and 1889,0604.68. From the same die: Miles, G.C. 1948. ‘Early Arabic Weights and Stamps’. New York, 30; Launois, Aimée. 1957. Estampilles et poids faibles en verre Omeyyades et Abbasides au Musée Arabe du Caire, ‘Mélanges islamologiques’ III, 95; Fahmi, A. 1957. ‘Sinaj al-sikka fī fajr al-Islām’. Cairo, 59; Launois, Aimée. 1959. ‘Estampilles et poids musulmans en verre du Cabinet des Médailles’ II. Cairo, 8; Miles, G.C. 1963. ‘Contributions to Arabic metrology’ II (I. Benaki Museum). New York, 12. Cf. Fahmi 1957, 60; Miles 1958, 51; Miles 1963 I, 11; Balog, P. 1976. ‘Ummayad, ʿAbbasid and Ṭūlūnid glass weights and vessel-stamps’. New York, 156-7.
The name of Muslim's father, al-ʿArrāf, is spelt without the rā’ on this die alone, an error which has long been recognized as such.
Bibliographic references: Morton 1985 / A Catalogue of Early Islamic Glass Stamps (78)
Associated names: Named in inscription: Muslim b. al-'Arrāf
